text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Practitioner ResourceA person with a formal responsibility in the provisioning of healthcare or related services
identifier 0..*IdentifierA identifier for the person as this agent
name 0..1HumanNameA name associated with the person
telecom 0..*ContactA contact detail for the practitioner
address 0..*AddressWhere practitioner can be found/visited
gender 0..1codemale | female | other | unknown
AdministrativeGender (Required)
birthDate 0..1dateTimeThe date and time of birth for the practitioner
photo 0..*AttachmentImage of the person
organization 0..1OrganizationThe represented organization
role 0..*CodeableConceptRoles which this practitioner may perform
PractitionerRole (Example)
specialty 0..*CodeableConceptSpecific specialty of the practitioner
PractitionerSpecialty (Example)
period 0..1PeriodThe period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
location 0..*LocationThe location(s) at which this practitioner provides care
qualification 0..*ElementQualifications obtained by training and certification
identifier 0..*IdentifierAn identifier for this qualification for the practitioner
code 1..1CodeableConceptCoded representation of the qualification
Qualification (Example)
period 0..1PeriodPeriod during which the qualification is valid
issuer 0..1OrganizationOrganization that regulates and issues the qualification
communication 0..*CodeableConceptA language the practitioner is able to use in patient communication
Language (Required)

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the Practitioner resource

definition.short: A person with a  formal responsibility in the provisioning of healthcare or related services
definition.formal: A person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare.
definition.comments: Note that a cab driver no longer fits the bill. You probably would be interested in the organization rather than the individual?.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Language of the resource content
definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.short: Contained, inline Resources
definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: A identifier for the person as this agent
definition.formal: An identifier that applies to this person in this role.

definition.short: A name associated with the person
definition.formal: A name associated with the person.

definition.short: A contact detail for the practitioner
definition.formal: A contact detail for the practitioner, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
definition.comments: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification.

definition.short: Where practitioner can be found/visited
definition.formal: The postal address where the practitioner can be found or visited or to which mail can be delivered.

definition.short: male | female | other | unknown
definition.formal: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes

definition.short: The date and time of birth for the practitioner
definition.formal: The date and time of birth for the practitioner.

definition.short: Image of the person
definition.formal: Image of the person.

definition.short: The represented organization
definition.formal: The organization that the practitioner represents.

mapping.map: PRD-10 (-> 14) / PRA-9-Institution / PRT-8-Participation Organization for person participation
(ServD maps Practitioners and Organizations via another entity, so this concept is not available)

definition.short: Roles which this practitioner may perform
definition.formal: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.
definition.comments: A person may have more than one role. At least one role is required.

binding.name: PractitionerRole
binding.description: The role a person plays representing an organization

mapping.map: PRD-1 / STF-18-job title / PRA-3-practitioner category  / PRT-4-Participation / ROL-3-role-ROL / ORC-12-ordering provider / OBR-16-ordering provider / PV1-7-attending doctor / PV1-8-referring doctor / PV1-9-consulting doctor / PV1-17-admitting doctor
(ServD maps Practitioners and Organizations via another entity, so this concept is not available)

definition.short: Specific specialty of the practitioner
definition.formal: Specific specialty of the practitioner.

binding.name: PractitionerSpecialty
binding.description: Specific specialty associated with the agency

definition.short: The period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
definition.formal: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.

mapping.map: (ServD maps Practitioners and Organizations via another entity, so this concept is not available)

definition.short: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care
definition.formal: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.

mapping.map:
(ServD maps Practitioners and Organizations via another entity, so this concept is not available)
However these are accessed via the Site.ServiceSite.ServiceSiteProvider record. (The Site has the location)

definition.short: Qualifications obtained by training and certification
definition.formal: Qualifications obtained by training and certification.

definition.short: An identifier for this qualification for the practitioner
definition.formal: An identifier that applies to this person's qualification in this role.

definition.short: Coded representation of the qualification
definition.formal: Coded representation of the qualification.

binding.name: Qualification
binding.description: Specific qualification the practitioner has to provide a service

definition.short: Period during which the qualification is valid
definition.formal: Period during which the qualification is valid.

definition.short: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification
definition.formal: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification.

definition.short: A language the practitioner is able to use in patient communication
definition.formal: A language the practitioner is able to use in patient communication.
definition.comments: The structure aa-BB with this exact casing is one the most widely used notations for locale. However not all systems actually code this but instead have it as free text. Hence CodeableConcept instead of code as the data type.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: address
searchParam.documentation: An address in any kind of address/part

searchParam.name: communication
searchParam.documentation: One of the languages that the practitioner can communicate with

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the family name

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the given name

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: A portion of either family or given name

searchParam.name: organization
searchParam.documentation: The identity of the organization the practitioner represents / acts on behalf of

searchParam.name: phonetic
searchParam.documentation: A portion of either family or given name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

searchParam.name: telecom
searchParam.documentation: The value in any kind of contact
